intro: Salsola abrotanoides, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its spiny, bract-like leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant is typically annual, with a mat-forming growth habit that allows it to spread rapidly in disturbed soils. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often becoming a weed in agricultural areas. Salsola abrotanoides is adapted to poor soils and can tolerate drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
